channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Overview of fractional calculus and its computer implementation in Wolfram Mathematica
item.description: arXiv:2306.11660v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article we would like to consider some approaches to non-integer integro-differentiations and its implementation in computer algebra system Wolfram Mathematics.
item.dc:creator: O. I. Marichev, E. L. Shishkina

item.title: Generalized Carlos Scales
item.description: arXiv:2408.14551v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In 1986, composer Wendy Carlos introduced three unusual musical scales she called alpha, beta and gamma, equal temperament-inspired scales that de-emphasize the octave as the primary interval in favor of the major and minor thirds and the perfect fifth. A derivation of the alpha, beta, and gamma scales due to David Benson is generalized to produce many Carlos-type scales.
item.dc:creator: Andrew V. Sills
